summary: Internal email from a federal prosecutor discussing negotiations with Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorney Lilly Ann Sanchez regarding subpoena compliance and a potential resolution to the federal investigation, including the possibility of concurrent sentencing with state charges. The email emphasizes urgency in obtaining computer equipment removed from Epstein's home.

persons.name: Lilly Ann Sanchez
persons.context: Attorney for Jeffrey Epstein who contacted the prosecutor requesting extensions for subpoena responses and indicated plans to propose a resolution with the state.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the federal investigation; his home was searched and computer equipment was removed prior to a state search warrant.

connections.description: Sanchez is acting as Epstein's defense attorney, communicating with prosecutors about subpoenas and potential case resolution.

events.title: Prosecutor's Email on Epstein Case Negotiations
events.description: A federal prosecutor sends an urgent email outlining response to Epstein's attorney regarding subpoena extensions and intent to discuss a resolution involving concurrent sentencing.

events.title: Removal of Computer Equipment from Epstein's Home
events.description: Computer equipment was removed from Jeffrey Epstein's home prior to the execution of a state search warrant, which the federal prosecutor is seeking to obtain.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense attorney Lilly Ann Sanchez requested extensions to respond to subpoenas and indicated plans to propose a resolution with state authorities.
Federal prosecutors prioritized obtaining computer equipment removed from Epstein's home before a state search warrant was executed.
The federal prosecutor was considering a resolution that could include concurrent sentencing for federal and state charges.
The communication was marked as high importance and urgent, indicating active negotiations in July 2007.
